WorkItem.Description:
The `InnerText` and `OuterHtml` properties of the `HtmlElement` are read only properties.  However the documentation for the properties start off with "Gets or Sets the..."
 
There are quite a few more inconsistencies on other properties of other classes as well.  The read/write differences are the major ones.  There are a number of minor ones as well such as phrasing (doesn't begin with the usual "Gets [or sets]") and various capitalization differences (noticed mostly in the capitalization of the 'S' in "Gets or Sets...").
 
* `HtmlAttribute`
    - `Name` (read/write): Does not mention it is writable.  Starts with "Gets the..."
    - `OriginalName`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
    - `QuoteType`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
 
* `HtmlCommentNode`
    - `OuterHtml` (read): Is a read only property.  Starts with "Gets or Sets the..."
 
* `HtmlEntity`
    - `EntityName`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
    - `EntityValue`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
 
* `HtmlNode`
    - `InnerText` (read): Is a read only property.  Starts with "Gets or Sets the..."
    - `OuterHtml` (read): Is a read only property.  Starts with "Gets or Sets the..."
    - `OriginalName`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
 
* `HtmlNodeCollection`
    - `IsReadOnly`: Inconsistent phrasing compared to the rest of the properties.
 
* `HtmlTextNode`
    - `OuterHtml` (read): Is a read only property.  Starts with "Gets or Sets the..."
 
* `MixedCodeDocumentCodeFragment`
    - `Code` (read/write): Does not mention it is writable.  Starts with "Gets the..."
 
* `MixedCodeDocumentTextFragment`
    - `Text` (read/write): Does not mention it is writable.  Starts with "Gets the..."
